column3: indicator_name
column4: indicator_description
column9: calculation_formula
column11: disaggregation_dimensions

column3: Proportion of livestock households below poverty line
column4: The percentage of livestock-keeping households whose income levels fall below the nationally defined poverty line.
column9: Number of livestock households below poverty line / Total livestock households * 100.
column11:
•Gender of household head
•Livestock production system (pastoral, agro-pastoral, mixed farming)
•Geographic region

column3: % of population with access to livestock products
column4: Measures the proportion of the population that has physical and economic access to livestock products (meat, milk, eggs) within a defined geographic area and time period.
column9: (Number of individuals with access to livestock products within acceptable distance and price thresholds ÷ Total population) × 100
column11:
• By region/state
• By urban/rural location
• By income quintile
• By livestock product type (meat, milk, eggs)

column3: Consumer Price Index for Livestock Products
column4: Measures changes over time in the average prices paid by consumers for a basket of livestock products, reflecting affordability and market stability.
column9: (Index of weighted average prices of selected livestock products in the current period ÷ Index in the base period) × 100
column11:
• By region/state
• By livestock product type
• By market type (urban, peri-urban, rural)

column3: Animal-Source Food Nutrition Adequacy Score (ASF-NAS)
column4: Measures the extent to which consumption of animal-source foods meets recommended dietary requirements for key nutrients, serving as a proxy for diet quality and nutritional adequacy.
column9: Composite score derived from household or individual consumption data, comparing intake of animal-source foods against recommended dietary allowances for selected nutrients.
column11:
• By region/state
• By age group
• By gender
• By livestock product type

column3: % contribution to GDP (Livestock Sector)
column4: Measures the economic significance of the national livestock sector by calculating the proportion of the country's total Gross Domestic Product (GDP) that is directly attributable to all livestock subsectors and their related value chains.
column9: Value added from livestock sector / Total national GDP * 100.
column11:
By Livestock Subsector:
•	Meat Production (Further breakdown by species where feasible: Beef, Poultry, Pork, Small Ruminants)
•	Dairy Production
•	Egg Production
•	Related Value Chain Activities (e.g., Feed Manufacturing, Processing, Trading)

column3: Annual Livestock Export Earnings (FX)
column4: Quantifies the total foreign exchange earnings generated from the export of live animals and livestock products (meat, milk, eggs, hides, skins, leather, and other by-products) within a financial year.
column9: Sum of all verified livestock export receipts recorded by customs, trade authorities, and exporting firms.
column11:
•By product category (live animals, meat, dairy, hides/skins)
•By exporting region/province
•By species (cattle, sheep, goats, poultry)

column3: Volume of livestock products exported (live animals meat dairy hides/skins)
column4: Measures the total quantity of livestock and livestock-derived products exported from the country, including live animals, meat, milk, eggs, hides, and skins.
column9: Aggregated sum of all livestock product exports verified through customs, trade authorities, or official export documentation.
column11:
•	By product type (live animals, meat, dairy, eggs, hides/skins)
•	By destination market (country/region)

column3: Number of  jobs created
column4: Total number of direct and indirect jobs generated across the livestock value chain within a defined period. It includes employment in production (farming), processing, transportation, trading, feed manufacturing, veterinary services, and allied input supply.
column9: Sum of all direct and indirect jobs reported across relevant livestock enterprises and programs.
column11:
•By gender (male, female)
•By age group (youth, adult)
•By value chain segment (production, processing, marketing, services)

column3: Average Income Change for Women/Youth in Programs
column4: Measures the change in average income earned by women and youth who participate in livestock-related programs, projects, or interventions over a defined implementation period
column9:
(Average post-intervention income ? Average baseline income)
Income should include all livestock-related earnings such as sales of animals, milk, eggs, meat, manure, by-products, or service fees
column10: Change in income expressed in local currency (e.g., NGN) or USD equivalent.
column11:
•	Gender (women, male youth, female youth)
•	Age category (e.g., 18–25, 26–35)
•	Type of livestock enterprise (dairy, poultry, small ruminants, beef, pigs)
•	Geographic location (state, LGA)
•	Program type or intervention thematic area

column3: Livestock Credit as % of Total Agricultural Lending
column4: Measure and track the financial support directed towards the livestock sector within the broader agricultural landscape
column9: (Total credit extended to livestock sector/Total agricultural credit extended) × 100
column11:
•	By financial institution type (commercial banks, microfinance, cooperatives)
•	By livestock subsector (cattle, poultry, small ruminants, pigs)

column3: Daily Animal Protein Consumption Per Capita
column4: Measures the average amount of animal-source protein consumed per person per day within the country. It captures both the volume of animal-source foods available for consumption and their proportional dietary contribution relative to population size.
column9: Total annual animal protein available for consumption (kg)/Total population / 365
column11: Urban vs. rural populations; Gender and age groups (children, adolescents, adults); animal-source food type (meat, milk, eggs, fish if included)

column3: Total number of animals by species (cattle, goat, sheep, poultry, pigs)
column4: Measures the total population of major livestock species within the country capturing the size, structure, and distribution of the national herd and flock
column9: Sum of all animals recorded across validated data sources.
column11:
•By species: cattle, goats, sheep, pigs, and poultry
•By production system: pastoral, agro-pastoral, semi-intensive, intensive
•By region/state

column3: Average Slaughter Weight per Cattle
column4: Measures the average live weight of cattle at the point of slaughter within formal and informal abattoirs reflecting nutritional status, breed quality, feeding systems, management practices, and overall production efficiency.
column9: Total live weight of slaughtered cattle/Total number of cattle slaughtered.
column11:
•	By breed/type (e.g., indigenous, crossbred, exotic)
•	By production system (pastoral vs. feedlot)
•	By geographic region

column3: Average Slaughter Weight per Goat
column4: Measures the average live weight per goat at the point of slaughter across formal and informal slaughter facilities reflecting the productivity, market readiness, and overall performance of goat production systems
column9: Sum of live weights of goats at slaughter / Total number of goats slaughtered
column11:
•	By production system: Pastoral, agro-pastoral, semi-intensive, intensive
•	By breed: Local, improved, crossbred
•	By region/state: Variations in feed availability and climate may affect growth
•	By age and sex: Kid, yearling, adult; male vs. female
•	By market type: Formal abattoirs vs. informal slaughter points

column3: Average Slaughter Weight per Pig
column4: Measures the average live weight of pigs at the time of slaughter during a specified reporting period providing a reliable metric of pig growth performance, feeding quality, health status, and production efficiency
column9: Sum of slaughter weights of sampled pigs ÷ Total number of pigs weighed
column11:
•	By production system (intensive, semi-intensive, backyard)
•	By breed/genetic line
•	By region/state

column3: Average Slaughter Weight per Poultry
column4: Measures the average live weight of poultry at the time of slaughter reflecting production efficiency, feed conversion performance, and overall flock health
column9: Total live weight of slaughtered birds/Total number of birds slaughtered.
column11:
•	By breed/strain
•	By production system (intensive vs. semi-intensive)
•	By region

column3: Total national meat production (all species)
column4: Measures the total volume of meat produced annually from all livestock species, including cattle, goats, sheep, pigs, and poultry
column9: Sum of total carcass weight produced from each livestock species,
column11:
•	By species (cattle, sheep, goats, pigs, poultry)
•	By production system
•	By region/state

column3: Average Daily Milk Yield Per Lactating Specie (Cow, Goat)
column4: Measures the average volume of milk produced per lactating species (cow,goat,sheep) per day reflecting dairy productivity and efficiency within the livestock sector.
column9: Total milk produced by lactating species (cow,goat,sheep) / Number of lactating species (cow,goat,sheep)
column10: Liters per lactating species (cow,goat,sheep) per day
column11:
•	By breed (local, crossbreed, exotic)
•	By production system (stall-fed, semi-intensive, pastoral)
•	By region

column3: Total national milk production
column4: Measures the total volume of milk produced nationally from all lactating species—predominantly cattle, goats, and sheep—over a one-year period. It includes milk consumed on-farm, sold in formal markets, traded in informal markets, or processed into dairy products.
column9: Sum of milk production volumes reported by producers and processors during the reporting year.
column11:
•	By species (cattle, goats, sheep, camels)
•	By production system (pastoral, agro-pastoral, commercial)
•	By region/state

column3: Volume of Honey produced annually
column4: Measures the total quantity of honey produced across the country within a calendar year, including production from traditional, transitional, and modern beekeeping systems.
column9: ? (Honey Output from All Producers)
column11:
•	By type of beekeeping system (traditional, transitional, modern)
•	By region/state
•	By scale (smallholder vs commercial producers)

column3: Total national egg production
column4: Measures the total quantity of eggs produced within the country across all poultry production systems—including commercial layer farms, backyard poultry, and semi-intensive operations—within a defined reporting period.
column9: Sum of eggs produced by registered poultry farms during the reporting year.
column11:
•	By production system (commercial, semi-intensive, backyard)
•	By region/state
•	By poultry species (if non-chicken egg production is relevant)

column3: Volume of commercially produced feed
column4: Measures the total annual quantity of livestock feed produced by commercial feed manufacturers nationally. It reflects the size, capacity, and growth trajectory of the feed industry,
column9: Aggregation of production volumes reported by licensed feed manufacturers.
column11:
•	By type of feed (poultry, dairy, beef, pig, fish)
•	By region
•	By production scale (large, medium, small feed mills)

column3: Total commercial feed production capacity
column4: Measures the total annual production capacity of commercially manufactured livestock feed in the country, including compound feed, concentrates, and premixes.
column9: Sum of the annual maximum production capacities reported by all operational commercial feed mills.
column11:
•	By feed type (cattle, poultry, pigs, small ruminants)
•	By region/state

column3: % of Abattoirs Meeting National Standards
column4: Measures the percentage of abattoirs in the country that meet nationally defined hygiene, operational, and structural standards
column9: (Number of abattoirs meeting national standards / Total abattoirs inspected) × 100
column11:
•	By abattoir size/type (small, medium, large)
•	By region/state

column3: Livestock Mortality Rate by Species (Cattle,Goat,Sheep,Pig,Poultry)
column4: Measures the proportion of livestock that die within a given period, disaggregated by species reflecting the health status, disease burden, environmental stress, and effectiveness of veterinary and husbandry practices across the sector
column9: (Number of livestock deaths / Total population of livestock) × 100.
column11:
•	By species: cattle, goats, sheep, pigs, poultry
•	By region
•	By production system

column3: % of animals vaccinated against Priority TADs ( PPR, FMD, NCD, ASF, CBPP)
column4: Measures the proportion of animals vaccinated against key priority diseases, including Peste des Petits Ruminants (PPR), Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD), Newcastle Disease (NCD), African Swine Fever (ASF), and Contagious Bovine Pleuropneumonia (CBPP).
column9: (Number of animals vaccinated / Total animal target population) × 100.
column11:
•	By disease type
•	By species
•	By region/state

column3: Prevalance rate of priority TADs (FMD,PPR,NCD,ASF,CBPP,Tickborne diseases,Trypanosomiasis)  across species
column4: Measures the proportion of livestock infected with key priority transboundary animal diseases within a specified period across all relevant species.
column9: (Number of infected animals for each TAD / Total population at risk) × 100
column11:
•	By species (cattle, goats, sheep, pigs, poultry)
•	By disease type
•	By region/state

column3: Livestock Extension Worker to Farmer Ratio
column4: Measures the average number of livestock farmers served by a single livestock extension worker reflecting the capacity of the extension system to deliver advisory, technical, and veterinary services to farmers.
column9: Total number of livestock farmers : Total number of livestock extension workers.
column11:
•	By state or region
•	By production system (pastoral, mixed, commercial)

column3: Veterinarian-to-livestock ratio
column4: Measures the ratio of qualified veterinarians to the total livestock population, reflecting the adequacy of veterinary service coverage.
column9: Total number of registered veterinarians / Total livestock population × 1,000
column11:
•	By species
•	By region/state

column3: % of Conflicts resolved by Functional Conflict Mitigation Committees
column4: Measures the proportion of livestock-related conflicts that are successfully resolved by established conflict mitigation committees at community, regional, or national levels.
column9: (Number of conflicts resolved by committees/Total number of reported conflicts) × 100
column11:
•	By conflict type (farmer-herder, market disputes, grazing disputes)
•	By region/state

column3: Farmer-Herder Conflict Response Time (Days)
column4: Measures the average number of days taken to respond to reported livestock-related conflicts between farmers and herders, from the time of report to the initiation of resolution or intervention.
column9: Average number of days from official report of conflict to documented resolution or intervention.
column11:
•	By region/state
•	By type of conflict (grazing disputes, crop damage, market disputes)

column3: Number of livestock related conflicts reported
column4: The total number of reported incidents of conflict directly involving livestock production, grazing, pastoral mobility, resource competition, or market disputes within a defined period.
column9: Total number of verified conflict incidents recorded during the reporting period through security agencies, community structures, local governments, and surveillance systems.
column11:
•By conflict type (farmer-herder, market dispute, grazing reserve, etc.)
•By location (state, LGA, community)
•By severity

column3: Disease surveillance system coverage
column4: Measures the extent to which livestock populations are covered by active disease surveillance programs, including routine monitoring, reporting, and early detection systems.
column9: (Number of animals monitored through the surveillance system / Total livestock population) × 100
column11:
•	By species (cattle, goats, sheep, pigs, poultry)
•	By region/state
•	By surveillance type (routine, targeted, sentinel)

column3: Number of reported outbreaks of transboundary diseases per 100,000 animals
column4: Measures the frequency of confirmed outbreaks of priority Transboundary Animal Diseases (TADs), standardized per 100,000 livestock. It captures the burden and spread of infectious diseases that can cross borders and rapidly affect animal populations, livelihoods, and trade.
column9: (Number of confirmed TAD outbreaks / Total livestock population) × 100,000.
column11:
•	By disease type (PPR, FMD, CBPP, etc.)
•	By species affected
•	By region or state

column3: Number of human Zoonotic Disease cases reported
column4: Measures the total number of confirmed human cases of zoonotic diseases attributable to livestock or livestock environments reflecting the intersection between animal health, human health, and environmental risk factors.
column9: Direct count of confirmed human cases reported through health and veterinary surveillance systems.
column11:
•	By disease type
•	By location
•	By age and gender

column3: Number of functional Water Points to Animals in Grazing Reserves
column4: Measures the adequacy of water infrastructure in grazing reserves by calculating the number of functional livestock water points available relative to the total animal population within each reserve
column9: Number of functional water points : Total number of animals in the grazing reserve.
column11:
•	By grazing reserve
•	By state or zone

column3: Total area of grazing land
column4: Measures the total land area officially designated or used for livestock grazing, including communal, private, and reserved grazing areas
column9: Sum of officially surveyed or mapped grazing lands across the country.
column11:
•	By region/state
•	By land type (communal, private, reserved)

column3: Percentage of grazing land in good/excellent condition
column4: Measures the proportion of total grazing land that meets defined standards of quality and productivity, including vegetation cover, forage availability, and soil health
column9: (Area of grazing land in good/excellent condition / Total grazing land area) × 100
column11:
•	By region/state
•	By type of grazing land (pastoral, mixed, community-managed)

column3: Community Animal Health Workers (CAHWs) Deployed and Active
column4: Measures the total number of trained Community Animal Health Workers (CAHWs) who are operational and actively providing basic veterinary and animal health services within their communities
column9: Count of all CAHWs who are actively providing verified animal health services in their communities.
column11:
•	By region/state
•	By gender
•	By type of livestock served (cattle, poultry, small ruminants, pigs)

column3: Number of Animals Registered in NAITS
column4: Measures the total number of animals registered in the National Animal Identification and Traceability System (NAITS), a system designed to uniquely identify animals for traceability, disease control, and market transparency
column9: Count of animals officially registered in NAITS, verified through the national database.
column11:
•	By species (cattle, goats, sheep, pigs, poultry)
•	By region/state

column3: Number of Functional Abbatiors
column4: Measures the total number of abattoirs that are operational, comply with national standards, and are actively processing livestock for human consumption.
column9: Count of abattoirs verified to be functional, meeting operational and hygienic standards during the reporting period.
column11:
•	By species processed (cattle, goats, sheep, pigs, poultry)
•	By region/state
•	By compliance level with national standards

column3: Number of operational breeding/AI centers
column4: Measures the total number of breeding or AI centers that are functional and actively providing services to improve livestock reproduction.
column9: Count of breeding/AI centers that are functional, staffed, and providing verified services during the reporting period.
column11:
•	By species served (cattle, goats, sheep, pigs)
•	By region/state

column3: Total cold storage capacity for livestock products
column4: Measures the total storage capacity available for perishable livestock products, including meat, milk, eggs, and other processed products, in refrigerated or frozen facilities.
column9: Sum of all operational cold storage facilities’ capacities as verified through inspections or official records.
column11:
•	By product type (meat, milk, eggs, hides/skins)
•	By region/state

column3: Number of functional commercial feedmills
column4: Measures the total number of commercial feedmills that are operational and producing livestock feed at or near capacity.
column9: Count of commercial feedmills meeting operational criteria verified through inspections or industry records.
column11:
•	By region/state
•	By type of feed produced (cattle, poultry, small ruminants, pigs)

column3: Number of functional Veterinary Diagnostic Centres
column4: Measures the total number of veterinary diagnostic laboratories or centers that are operational and capable of performing disease testing, pathogen identification, and providing diagnostic services to support livestock health management
column9: Count of diagnostic centers verified to be operational, staffed with trained personnel, and providing validated testing services
column11:
•	By region/state
•	By species supported
•	By diagnostic capability (routine testing, advanced pathology, molecular diagnostics)

column3: Value of Private/PPP Investment Mobilized
column4: Measures the total monetary value of private sector and Public-Private Partnership (PPP) investments mobilized for livestock production, processing, and related value chain activities.
column9: Sum of all verified financial commitments and disbursements made by private investors and PPPs in livestock enterprises within the reporting period.
column11:
•	By investment type (production, processing, infrastructure, services)
•	By source (private sector, PPP)

column3: Number of Commercial livestock Farms with Active Insurance
column4: Measures the total number of commercial livestock farmers who have enrolled in and maintain active insurance coverage for their animals and production risks.
column9: Count of commercial livestock farmers with active, verified insurance policies for livestock production risks.
column11:
•	By species insured (cattle, poultry, goats, sheep, pigs)
•	By region/state
•	By farm size

column3: Number of Livestock insured
column4: Measures the total number of livestock covered by formal insurance policies that provide financial protection against risks such as disease, theft, or natural disasters.
column9: Count of livestock with verified active insurance coverage during the reporting period.
column11:
•	By species (cattle, goats, sheep, pigs, poultry)
•	By region/state
•	By insurance type (full, partial, indemnity-based)

column3: Number of Conflict Mitigation Committee Members Trained
column4: Measures the total number of individuals serving on livestock conflict mitigation committees who have received formal training on dispute resolution, mediation, and conflict management.
column9: Count of committee members who have completed verified training programs within the reporting period.
column11:
•	By gender
•	By training type or module
•	By region/state

column3: Number of Transhumance Routes with Formalized Access Agreements
column4: Measures the total number of pastoralist and livestock transhumance routes that have legally recognized and documented agreements for movement, grazing, and water access
column9: Count of transhumance routes with legally documented, active access agreements validated by local authorities.
column11:
•	By region/state
•	By route type (long-distance, seasonal)

column3: Number of Livestock Enterprises Owned by Women and Youth
column4: Measures the number of registered or surveyed livestock enterprises that are owned or managed by women and youth, highlighting inclusivity and demographic participation in the sector.
column9: (Number of women/youth-owned enterprises / Total number of enterprises surveyed) × 100
column11:
•	By gender (women)
•	By age group (youth, typically 18–35 years)
•	By livestock subsector

column3: Number of Women/Youth Accessing Livestock Finance
column4: Measures the total number of women and youth who have successfully obtained formal or program-supported finance for livestock production, processing, or value chain activities
column9: Count of verified women and youth who accessed livestock-related loans or credit facilities during the reporting period.
column11:
•	By gender and age
•	By type of livestock financed
•	By region/state

column3: Number of Livestock Cottage Industries Established
column4: Measures the total number of small-scale, often family-owned livestock-related enterprises established within a specified period, including processing, feed production, and value-added services.
column9: Count of verified small-scale livestock enterprises formally registered or recognized by local authorities.
column11:
•	By type of enterprise (processing, feed production, services)
•	By region/state

column3: Number of States with Functional NLIMS
column4: Measures the number of states with fully operational National Livestock Information Management System (NLIMS) platforms capable of managing livestock data, including animal registration, disease monitoring, and production statistics
column9: Count of number of states with fully functional NLIMS
column11:
•	By state
•	By livestock subsector coverage

column3: Frequency of National Livestock Statistics Publication by FMLD
column4: Measures the number of times the Federal Ministry of Livestock Development (FMLD) officially publishes livestock statistics within a calendar year.
column9: Count of official livestock statistical reports published and disseminated by FMLD within the reporting year.
column11: None

column3: Number of request of NLIMS data
column4: Measures the total number of formal requests received for data from the National Livestock Information Management System (NLIMS), reflecting data utilization and stakeholder demand.
column9: Count of documented and approved data requests submitted through official NLIMS channels within the reporting period.
column11:
• By requesting institution type (government, research, private sector, development partners)
• By data category requested
• By region/state of intended use

column3: Number of Livestock Farmers Enrolled in National Database
column4: Measures the number of livestock farmers registered in the national livestock database or management system, reflecting the coverage and adoption of formal registration systems.
column9: (Number of farmers registered in national database/Total estimated livestock farmers) × 100
column11:
•	By region/state
•	By gender
•	By farm type (commercial, smallholder, pastoralist)

column3: Average interest rate for livestock loans
column4: Measures the mean interest rate charged on loans provided to livestock farmers by formal financial institutions
column9: Sum of interest rates charged on all loans / Number of loans issued to livestock farmers during the period.
column11:
•	By type of livestock financed
•	By financial institution type (bank, microfinance, cooperative)

column3: Number of livestock farmers accessing formal credit
column4: Measures the total number of livestock farmers who have obtained formal loans from banks, microfinance institutions, or other accredited financial providers.
column9: Count of farmers who have received verified loans or credit facilities from formal financial institutions during the reporting period
column11:
•	By gender and age (women, youth)
•	By livestock subsector (cattle, poultry, goats, sheep, pigs)
•	By region/state

column3: Number of Quarantine station coverage at border crossings
column4: Measures the total number of quarantine stations that are operational at official border points to monitor, inspect, and control the movement of livestock entering or leaving the country.
column9: Count of quarantine stations verified to be operational, staffed, and enforcing biosecurity protocols during the reporting period.
column11:
•	By border type (land, sea, air)
•	By region/state
•	By species covered

column3: Number of livestock farmers supported with animal husbandry inputs
column4: Measures the total number of livestock farmers who received animal husbandry inputs, including feed, housing materials, equipment, or related production support, within the reporting period.
column9: Count of livestock farmers who received at least one verified animal husbandry input.
column11:
• By region/state
• By livestock species
• By farmer category (smallholder, commercial)

column3: Number of livestock farmers supported with veterinary inputs
column4: Measures the total number of livestock farmers who received veterinary inputs, including drugs, vaccines, diagnostic kits, or treatment services.
column9: Count of livestock farmers with documented receipt of veterinary inputs
column11:
• By region/state
• By livestock species
• By type of veterinary input

column3: Quantity of Meat produced annually (Mt)
column4: Measures the total quantity of meat produced within the reporting year from all livestock species.
column9: Sum of carcass weight from slaughtered animals recorded in abattoirs and slaughter slabs during the reporting year.
column11:
• By region/state
• By livestock species
• By production system (formal/informal)

column3: Quantity of milk produced annually (Litres)
column4: Measures the total quantity of milk produced by livestock within the reporting year.
column9: Sum of milk production volumes reported by producers and processors during the reporting year.
column11:
•	By species (cattle, goats, sheep, camels)
•	By production system (pastoral, agro-pastoral, commercial)
•	By region/state

column3: Quantity of eggs produced annually (Crates)
column4: Measures the total quantity of eggs produced by poultry systems within the reporting year
column9: Sum of eggs produced by registered poultry farms during the reporting year.
column11:
•	By production system (commercial, semi-intensive, backyard)
•	By region/state
•	By poultry species (if non-chicken egg production is relevant)

column3: Weight of honey produced annually (kg)
column4: Measures the total weight of honey produced by beekeepers within the reporting year.
column9: Sum of honey production volumes reported by supported and registered beekeepers.
column11:
• By region/state
• By production system (traditional, modern)

column3: Number of youths and women trained and supported with livestock starter packs
column4: Measures the total number of youths and women who received training and livestock starter packs to support entry into livestock production
column9: Count of beneficiaries with documented training completion and receipt of starter packs
column11:
• By region/state
• By gender
• By age group

column3: Number of bee keepers trained and supported with bee starter packs
column4: Measures the total number of beekeepers who received training and bee starter packs to support apiculture activities.
column9: Count of trained beekeepers with documented receipt of starter packs
column11:
• By region/state
• By gender

column3: Number of livestock farmers trained in modern production techniques
column4: Measures the total number of livestock farmers trained in improved and modern livestock production practices.
column9: Count of livestock farmers who completed certified training sessions.
column11:
• By region/state
• By livestock species
• By production technique

column3: Number of breeder farmers supported with improved breeds
column4: Measures the total number of breeder farmers who received improved livestock breeds for genetic enhancement.
column9: Count of breeder farmers with verified receipt of improved breeds.
column11:
• By region/state
• By livestock species
• By breed type

column3: Number of animals artificially inseminated
column4: Measures the total number of animals that received artificial insemination services during the reporting period.
column9: Count of insemination procedures recorded by accredited technicians.
column11:
• By region/state
• By livestock species

column3: Number of embryos transferred into recipient animals
column4: Measures the total number of embryos successfully transferred into recipient animals.
column9: Count of embryo transfer procedures conducted and recorded
column11:
• By region/state
• By livestock species

column3: Quantity (doses) of animal vaccines produced annually (million)
column4: Measures the total quantity of animal vaccine doses produced within the reporting year.
column9: Sum of vaccine doses produced by accredited laboratories during the reporting year
column11:
• By vaccine type
• By producing institution

column3: Number of vaccine doses distributed to States (million)
column4: Measures the total number of animal vaccine doses distributed to states for livestock disease control.
column9: Sum of vaccine doses officially distributed and acknowledged by states.
column11:
• By region/state
• By vaccine type

column3: Number of animals vaccinated during national campaigns (million)
column4: Measures the total number of animals vaccinated during officially sanctioned national vaccination campaigns.
column9: Count of animals vaccinated as recorded in campaign reports.
column11:
• By region/state
• By livestock species

column3: Quantity of disinfectants distributed to States (Liters)
column4: Measures the total volume of disinfectants distributed to states for livestock disease prevention and biosecurity.
column9: Sum of disinfectant volumes officially distributed.
column11:
• By region/state
• By disinfectant type

column3: Number of sensitization/awareness campaigns on TADs and Zoonoses
column4: Mmeasures the total number of sensitization and awareness campaigns conducted on Transboundary Animal Diseases (TADs) and zoonotic diseases.
column9: Count of completed and documented campaigns.
column11:
• By region/state
